docs.title: Homepage
docs.text: sample text

docs.title: Skin metadata
docs.text: Option Required? Value type Description Version added Default value GameVersion String Minimum required Linum version to be able to play with this skin 0.2.0 Version Integer Skin’s own version, up this by 1 when you make a change, this is for multiplayer lobbies to differentiate if someone has an outdated version of a skin 0.2.0 1 Name String Skin’s full name 0.2.0 ShortName String Skin’s shortened name, for various menus 0.2.0 If not set, Name will be used instead Author String Who made the skin, duh 0.2.0 Description List Skin’s description, you can use it to tell what game it’s from or who made the sprites Use | to make new lines 0.2.0

docs.title: Markdown template
docs.text: Click "Edit" to see how all of the things here are written Note: every preview is placed in admonitions

docs.title: Extended syntax
docs.text: Quick rundown through syntax available with extensions, which can be explained quickly

docs.title: Nesting elements
docs.text:
uses extension: pymdownx.superfcences

This is a quote 

This is a code block

inside a quote

docs.title: Converting special symbols
docs.text:
uses extensions: smarty, pymdownx.smartsymbols

These are the symbols that get replaced: ™ © ® ℅ ± ≠ → ← ↔ ½ ¼ ⅝ 1st 2nd 3rd 4th « » … – —

docs.title: GitHub links
docs.text:
uses extension: pymdownx.magiclink

User mention: @halatnikov Repository link: halatnikov/linum-framework

Links for Linum:

Issue: #1 Pull request: !1 Discussion: ?1 Commit: 7dbdb07 Diff/Compare: 3fdc4e6...d2e1bec

Links for other repositories:

Issue: STJr/SRB2#206 Pull request: alemart/opensurge!49 Discussion: ppy/osu?13096 Commit: STJr/Kart-Public@7ab1c4a Diff/Compare: mmatyas/supermariowar@57b639c...3917df2

Converting of existing links:

STJr/SRB2#206 ppy/osu?13096

Also supports Twitter mentions: @holatnikov

A few custom links:

Changelog for versions: 0.1.0 0.2.0

docs.title: Marking
docs.text:
uses extension: pymdownx.mark

This is a marked text A word can be highlighted too

docs.title: Inserting (underscoring)
docs.text:
uses extension: pymdownx.caret

This is an inserted text A word can be underscored too

docs.title: Deleting (strike-through)
docs.text:
uses extension: pymdownx.tilde

This is a deleted text A word can be striked-through too

docs.title: Emoji and icons
docs.text:
Full list can be found here uses extension: pymdownx.emoji

Emoji: Icon (replace all / with -):

docs.title: Buttons
docs.text:
Just a regular link but with an attribute attached uses extension: attr_list

Empty button

Filled button

docs.title: Keyboard keys
docs.text:
A full list can be found here uses extension: pymdownx.keys

Ctrl+Alt+Del Z Alt+F4 Up+Up+Down+Down+Left+Right+Left+Right+B+A+Enter

docs.title: Progress bars
docs.text:
Colored according to their progress uses extensions: pymdownx.progressbar, attr_list

Regular:

Can use titles

50%

Full

Striped:

Striped static

Striped animated

Thin:

docs.title: Superscript
docs.text:
Small symbols facing up uses extension: pymdownx.caret

H20 This is a superscript

docs.title: Subscript
docs.text:
Small symbols facing down uses extension: pymdownx.tilde

CH3CH2OH This is a subscript

docs.title: Footnotes
docs.text:
Usually these are at the bottom of page, but for now they're here uses extension: footnotes

This is a text1 that contains 2 footnotes2

  1. This is the content of a first footnote ↩

  2. That's the 2nd footnote's content ↩

docs.title: Highlighting changes
docs.text:
This has a somewhat limited use scope uses extension: pymdownx.critic

You can make striked-through text red and underscored text green And also make comments inline

You can do blocks too!

docs.title: Tabs
docs.text:
uses extension: pymdownx.tabbed

Tab 1Tab 2

this is a tab

  • it can contain anything
this is a code block in a tab
which is kinda a primary target for these

docs.title: Abbreviations
docs.text: Only plain text is supported uses extension: abbr

docs.title: Regular
docs.text: This can technically be any word whatsoever

docs.title: With a dictionary
docs.text:
See bottom of this file in editor uses extension: pymdownx.snippets

The INI files that Linum uses are actually converted to JSON in-engine

docs.title: Admonitions
docs.text: Also known as call-outs uses extension: admonition

docs.title: Regular blocks
docs.text:
This is a title

This is a text

Look, there's no title

docs.title: Collapsible blocks
docs.text:
uses extension: pymdownx.details

Closed

This is a closed collapsible block

Open

This is an open collapsible block

docs.title: Types of blocks
docs.text:
Click to open

Built-in:

Note

Summary

abstract, tldr

Info

todo

Hint

tip, important

Success

check, done

Help

question, faq

Warning

caution, attention

Fail

missing

Danger

error

Bug

Example

Quote

docs.title: Regular
docs.text:
this is an inline code block 

this is a code block
	line 2
		line 3

docs.title: Syntax highlighting
docs.text:
uses extensions: pymdownx.highlight, pymdownx.inlinehilite

in an inline code block: [Section] in a regular code block: 

[Section]
key=value
# comment

docs.title: Adding a title
docs.text:
uses extension: pymdownx.highlight

This is a title
indeed it is

docs.title: Code annotations
docs.text:
uses feature flag: content.code.annotate

# comment (1)
  1. this a code annotation, it can be placed anywhere where a comment can be placed in that language

docs.title: Line numbers
docs.text:
uses extension: pymdownx.highlight

can start from any line: 

[Section]
key=value
# comment
you can also mark them: 
[Section]
key=value
key2=value2
# comment

docs.title: Embedding external files
docs.text:
uses extension: pymdownx.snippets

LinumDefault/levels/example/leveldata/_mapdata.ini

docs.title: Tables
docs.text: uses extension: tables

docs.title: Regular
docs.text: this is a table left-aligned middle-aligned right-aligned 1 2 3

docs.title: Sorted table
docs.text:
Every table can also be sorted by clicking on headers uses javascript: tablesort

Number Alphabetical Version Date 0 C 0.1.0 01/Jan/2022 1 B 0.7.8 10/Feb/2022 2 A 0.2.3 20-Mar-2022 5 M 0.1.1 30-Apr-2023 10 Z 1.0.0 02/Dec/2022
